intro: Setaria decipiens f. schultheissii, commonly known as the Schultheiss false panicgrass, is a variant of the false panicgrass species. It is a grass-like plant characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has small, spike-like inflorescences that produce tiny grains, typical of the Poaceae family. Its botanical features make it distinguishable from other Setaria species through its specific morphological traits.
